alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:03PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Imperial County through 445 PM PDT... At 403 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Salton City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salton City, Salton Sea Beach and Winona. This includes CA Route 86 between mile markers 50 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
